subject: Batch Snaps 2021 | Tentative Dates and Announcement
body:
Greetings from *Student Alumni Relations Cell*!

We understand that Batch Snaps and the Yearbook are an integral part of
every BITSian=E2=80=99s Life and capture the nostalgic memories of the grad=
uating
batch. The eventful years spent on the campus with seniors, batchmates and
juniors turn into lifelong friendships. The Yearbook and Photos are what
capture these memories for years to come.

Traditionally, the Batch Snaps are held in the second semester of your
pre-final year. However, due to COVID, they were not organized for the past
two years. With things being normalized and students back on campus, the
Student Alumni Relations Cell is elated to announce that we are organizing
the Batch Snaps for FD Batch of 2018 (Single Degree and Dual Degree
Students), HD Batch of 2020 and MBA Batch of 2020, tentatively on 19th,
20th and 21st November 2021 (Friday, Saturday and Sunday).

This has been planned after extensive discussion and proper permissions
from the administration and Director. According to your branch, they will
be organized in slots, and every student participating in the Batch Snaps
will have to *strictly follow all mandated guidelines*. A comprehensive
document will be soon shared with detailed instructions, guidelines and
schedule. This mail has been sent so that students can plan their leaves
accordingly if they wish to participate in the Batch Snaps.

The snaps will be organized on the dates mentioned above unless
communicated otherwise due to unavoidable circumstances. Please note that
you would be only allowed to enter the venue in your designated slots, and
this will be organized just for the students of the graduating batch who
are on campus.

We are aware that some 2018 FD Single Degree Students are on PS-2. For such
students, we would probably organize them next semester if the conditions
allow. Please find attached a Document
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/1F6n8mVwescMLt94zmNhSpR4szE5x3pva/view?usp=
=3Dsharing>
with some frequently asked questions.


We encourage you to contact the undersigned if you have any other doubts:

Yash Thakker: +91 9725791724

Vidushi Sahay: +91 9871941631


*Regards,*
*Student Alumni Relations Cell*

subject: Roshani- An Initiative by Nirmaan! (Reminder mail)

Greetings everyone,

May this festival add new hope, confidence, and courage to your heart,
preparing you for a successful journey forward.

Nirmaan volunteers understand the importance of volunteer work and its role
in providing better opportunities and equality for everyone. Working online
for the last one and half years has

working on the campus. To kickstart our momentum for the women empowerment
projects this year we bring forth to you Roshani!

subject: Fundraiser
body:
*Greetings from the Students' Union,*
It is with a heavy heart that we have to inform you that Shri Mukesh, an
employee of the BITS COOP store has passed away on the night of 18th
October, 2021. He had been suffering from mouth cancer for the past one
year and has left behind a family of which he was the only income source.

Shri Ratan Singh, owner of our beloved Gandhi Redi, has also been battling
with blood cancer over the past year.

We hope that the BITSian community will step forward in their time of need
and contribute to reducing their financial burden.

Kindly fill the google form given below to donate, the amount would
directly be deducted from the SWD account of the student :
Form link <https://forms.gle/vzki1AKb2Hnecgry7>

Please remember that every single donation counts and will directly impact
lives. Let us come together in characteristic BITSian style and support
these individuals who have dedicated their lives to this place we all call
home.

--

*Regards*
*Students' Union 2021-22*

subject: Call for Submission of Articles for Taleem, TLC Newsletter
body:
Dear Faculty Members, Research Scholars and Students,



The Teaching-Learning Centre invites articles for the upcoming issue of the
newsletter, Taleem. The focus of the upcoming issue is =E2=80=9CEffective
Integration of Teaching and Research=E2=80=9D. Please find below a brief
description of the topic:





Maintaining a healthy balance between teaching and research has been a
topic of much discussion. With research publication acquiring more
importance in recent times, there has been a major concern that the quality
of teaching might be compromised. While the undergraduate students may not
be interested in the latest research in the field, teachers are expected to
maintain an active research profile. The tendency to think of research and
teaching as mutually exclusive aggravates the situation. In the light of
these, the next issue of Taleem aims to initiate a discussion on how
teachers can think of ways in which teaching and research can be integrated
effectively, thereby evolving a model where teaching and research will be
complimentary.



The Teaching Learning Centre invites articles from faculty members,
research scholars, students, and administrators on the above-mentioned
topic. We request you to send us your valuable contributions on any aspect
of the questions of =E2=80=9CEffective Integration of Teaching and Research=
=E2=80=9D with
an approximate limit of four hundred words. You can also contribute to
cartoons, memes, etc.





The deadline for submission is 15 November 2021.

Kindly send your articles to

taleem.tlc.bits@gmail.com

The objective of the funding is to support first-degree students to carry
out important and innovative projects in an academic year.

subject: Post mid-sem break
body:
Dear Student,


You are allowed to *leave for home* after the mid-sem (only). The procedure
for the same is as follows:



   - The leave should be applied *through a portal only*. Any email/phone
   call for the leave won't be entertained.
   - The respective hostel warden will approve the leave through the
   portal. Only after the approval you will be permitted to leave.
   - The leave should be applied (through the portal) at least *24 hours*
   before leaving the campus.
   - Only in case of any *unavoidable circumstances*, the time limit will
   be relaxed.
   - No phone calls for unnecessary requests will be entertained.
   - Upon return from the break, a student has to produce the negative
   report of the RT-PCR done from an ICMR approved lab [ valid for 72 hours]
   (even if they are fully vaccinated).
   - Parents *won't be allowed* inside campus when the students return from
   their post-mid-sem break.
   - Remember, you can avail the *leave once* in the current semester.


*P.S.: You will be receiving a notification about the portal very soon.*


*No queries in this regard will be entertained. We will cancel the leave
request in case of receiving any email in this regard!*


With best wishes,



*Navin Singh* <http://universe.bits-pilani.ac.in/pilani/navin/profile>

                            Dated: July 18, 2019

*NOTICE*

*Institute Merit-Cum-Need Scholarships, First Semester, 2019-2020*

*All first degree students should note the following procedure for applying
for the Institute Merit-cum-Need Scholarships for First Semester 2019-2020*
*.*





1.      The award of scholarships will be decided at the end of First
Semester and will be based on the performance of students in the First
Semester.



2.      The types of scholarships are as follows:



                              i.)            Merit Scholarships: These will

semester fees for 2% students.



                            ii.)            Merit-cum-Need Scholarships:
These will cover 80% reimbursement of semester fees for 3% students; 40% of
semester fees for 6% students; 25% of semester fees for 12% students and
15% of semester fees for 6% students.



3.      There is no waiver of admission fee.



4.      No application is necessary for Merit Scholarships.

Thursday,                                  26th September 2019, through SWD
website link (http://swd.bits-pilani.ac.in). This will be accessible from 1=
0
th August 2019.



6.      Latest income certificate(s) should be submitted before the
deadline along with the details of the applicant on a cover sheet available
at SWD office (Room No. 2101).



*DOCUMENTS TO BE SUBMITTED*

The following documents for the *FINANCIAL YEAR 2018-19 (ASSESSMENT YEAR
2019-20)* should be submitted:-

*If parents/guardians are*:

*Salaried/Engaged in Business/Pensioner* =E2=80=93



a)       If parent(s)/guardian are *salaried persons/Business*, Copy of  *I=
TR
V along with Computation of income* stamped by IT department clearly
showing the gross income can  be submitted (copy of E-Filing of returns is
also valid).

b)      If Engaged in *Agriculture only* =E2=80=93 Original Income Certific=
ate
from *Mandal
Revenue* *Officer* gross income for the *financial year* *2018-2019*
(*ASSESSMENT
YEAR 2019-20)* based on the income of the preceding financial year along
with parents bank statement for past six months. In case of any educational
loan, a copy of loan sanction letter to be submitted.



c)       *Pensioners *shall submit the Retirement letter along with the
bank statement showing the pension credited. In case of any educational
loan, a copy of loan sanction letter to be submitted.



*NOTE*

*1)      **AFFIDAVITS* are directly rejected.

*2)      **Mere income statements* and *declarations* by parents/their
employers, notary affidavit, certificate from bank, annual pension
statements etc will not be accepted.

*3)      *Income certificates of *BOTH *parents must be provided in case
both are earning persons.

*4)      *All the income statements should be for the *Financial Year
2018-19 (Assessment Year* *2019-20) dated after 1st April 2019.*

*5)      *Income statements of *earlier years* will be *directly rejected*.



      *THE ELIGIBILTY CRITERIA FOR AWARD OF SCHOLARSHIP*

*a)   *The scholarships are awarded to students based on *CGPA* and gross
annual income of parent(s)/guardian from all sources should be less than
the maximum prescribed by the Scholarships Committee. Prescribed maximum
limit for the previous semester was Rs. 10,00,000/- p.a.

*b)   *No NC/E report in the first semester.

*c)   *No case of indiscipline in the semester for which scholarship is
applied.

*d)   *Not availing any external scholarship that carries a condition that
the student is not receiving any other scholarship. Students are to certify
that they are not availing any other scholarship such as Inspire/KVPY etc.
Any student availing fee benefit scheme is not eligible.

*e)   *In case of any ambiguity, certificates in original should be
produced by the student on demand.

*f)     *Any discrepancies in the Parents details provided when compared
with the previous semester the application will be directly rejected
without any intimation.

*g)   *Both the Parents/guardians gross total income should be clearly
mentioned.

*h)    *The application for MCN should be filled in very clearly and no
changes will be encouraged later.

*i)     *All the applications, documents and certificates will be
scrutinized by the authorities.



It is the responsibility of all the students to *check notices and SWD
Portal or contact the SWD* *office* for details of the MCN Scholarship.



All decisions of the *Scholarships Committee* are final and binding.

subject: Some measures you may take to avoid Dengue
body:
Dear All,

        In view of the expected rise in the number of cases of Dengue
during the coming days, the following steps may help.

       Try to avoid sitting/standing  outdoors early mornings and evenings
before dark.

        Wear full sleeves shirts,pants and socks if you need to come out of
rooms at these times.Mosquito repellent creams may also be applied
instead.(The mosquito prefers biting at legs and feet).

         Use mosquito repellant like 'All Out','Good Night',etc inside the
rooms.Please keep one window open while using these so that the fumes don't
get collected inside.

         Dengue fever causes fever as high as 102 to 103 degree F with
severe headache,backache and nausea.There is no associated cough,runny nose
or sore throat.If any one has these symptoms

         he/she should take Paracetamol 650 mg (for those weighing more
than 50kg) and inform the Hostel Superintendent to seek medical help.(Each
Superintendent keeps Paracetamol tablet in his/her First

         aid kit).

          Warm regards,

         Dr Rajiv Gupta CMO.

subject: Online leave through LMS
body:
Dear Student,

Please find the guidelines to apply for the outstation leave.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
*You should follow the following steps to apply for the leave*:

Please download the mobile app "*SWD leave management system*" through
the *Google
play store* and install to your smartphone. You can use the *IP 172.22.6.2*
to login to SWD leave management portal. This facility is provided by "SBNA
Technology".


   1. Login first through your username which is your ID (For example
   2017A1PS0000 or 2017B1A10000. For higher degree students 2017H0000000).
   Your password (first time) will be twice of your ID. Please change your
   password after the first login. If you still could not login in, please get
   it to reset from SWD.
   2. After login click + button on the screen and apply for your leave
   after filling all fields.
   3. Once your *warden approves* leave an *SMS will go to your parent
   mobile* number which is registered with us. You can also check whether
   your leave is approved or not.
   4. Please apply for your outstation leave *at least 24 hrs* in advance.
   Your warden will approve leave once a day. Contact your warden regarding
   this.
   5. At the time of leaving campus, *put your thumb at the proper
   biometric machine* (a security person at the gate will assist you)
   installed at the gate and proceed for the leave. At that point of time,
   your parent will get another SMS.
   6. After your leave completion put your thumb again in the bio-metric
   machine which will confirm your entry in campus and will inform the parent
   (BY SMS) that you have reached the campus.


*Note:* *If your thumb impression is not registered with SWD, then the
security personal will not allow you to leave campus. If you face any issue
with leave application contact SWD*.



*POINT TO NOTE*


   1. If you are going out of the campus *after 8:00 PM,* you must take
   prior permission by filling out and submitting the Outstation Form Online.
   2. The online outstation form must be filled and submitted before 24
   hours of your departure; for example: if you have to leave the campus at 10
   AM tomorrow then the outstation form must be submitted by 10:00 AM today or
   earlier.
   3. The reason for going out must be clearly stated; otherwise, your
   application is liable to be rejected.
   4. The online outstation form can be filled in the following TWO ways:


   - *via the mobile app* as follows:
      - Download the mobile app "*SWD leave management system*" through the
      Google Play store and install to your smartphone. You can use the IP
      *172.22.6.2* to login to SWD leave management portal. This facility
      is provided by "SBNA Technology".
      - Login first through your username which is your ID (For example
      *2017A1PS0000* or 2017B1A10000. For higher degree students
      *2017H0000000*).
      - Your password (first time) will be twice of your ID. Please change
      your password after the first login. If you still cannot login in, please
      get it to reset from SWD.


   - *via PC app* (i.e. the app can be downloaded on your PC using the same
      IP: http://172.22.6.2/ It will show SBNA technologies logo)


NOTE: the *PC app works* equally well. It often works *better than the
mobile app.*


   - If you are facing problems in accessing your online leave management
   portal, please contact SWD office immediately to get it fixed.
   - Excuses for not following the above instructions will not be accepted.


*NOTE:* If you call up any of the wardens from the BITS the main gate for
granting permission to leave, you will be denied permission to leave.


With best regards,

*Navin Singh* <http://universe.bits-pilani.ac.in/pilani/navin/profile>
(Chief Warden)

2.   A limited number of students with high performance can also be

Group A to Group C, Group B to Group B, Group B to Group C. These are
called =E2=80=98*other priorities=E2=80=99*. The number of students who may=

a dual degree in any of the programmes will be very limited. In the case of
students who want to do a dual degree in Group B, there will be a liberal
approach in considering their applications. Students are required to apply
as per the procedure described below.

*For Transfer:*

3.   *Transfer within the same tier*:

The Institute=E2=80=99s Academic Regulations allow transfer from one progra=
mme to
another in limited cases. In the case of Integrated first degree, transfer
may be allowed from one programme to another programme within the
first-degree programmes. Normally such transfers are done only when the
students are exceptionally meritorious. For example: Transfer from B2 =E2=
=86=92 B3
or B1 =E2=86=92  A7, A4 =E2=86=92  A8 etc.



*4.   **Transfer from Integrated First Degree Programme to Higher Degree
and/or Ph.D. Programme:*

Bright and highly motivated students of Integrated first-degree programme
can seek transfer to the higher degree and/or Ph.D. Such a student may also
be awarded the intermediate degree(s) upon successful completion of all
requirements of the same. Normally such transfers are done at the end of
second year or later. However, students who are at earlier stages may also
apply to seek counseling in this matter.



5.    *Transfer from Higher Degree Programme to Ph.D. Programme:*

A higher degree student may be transferred to a Ph.D. programme if found
suitable. Such a student may also be awarded the higher degree on
successful completion of requirements of the same.

subject: Message from CRT
body:
The country has witnessed an alarming increase in Covid-19 cases in the
last few days including Rajasthan. Kindly note there were only 60 new
infected cases on a single day on February 16 in the state, but it rose to
1,350 cases on April 1. On February 23, the total active cases were 1,195,
but on April 1, the number increased to 9,563.

All of you will agree that campus has been reasonably safe and secured due
to discipline from the campus residents. Now, tts high time that we become
all the more cautious. Hence, in order to keep our campus safe, cooperation
from all residents is required.

As a precautionary measure, the following steps will be implemented with
immediate effect.

(1) Students will not be allowed to go outside the campus, except for a
medical emergency.

(2) All cycles of student entry will remain suspended till further notice.
If a student decides to go home for any reason, he will not be allowed to
come back till further orders.

(3) The BITS faculty, staff, and their family members are discouraged to
leave the campus except for medical emergencies, to be approved by CMO.

(4) The BITS faculty, staff, and their family members coming from another
city have to produce a COVID- negative report (not older than 72 Hrs) of
RT-PCR or the final certificate of vaccination. In absence of such a
report, they have to meet the campus doctor and remain home isolated for 15
days.

(5) It is necessary for all visitors/Vendor/ technicians/supplier/ service
engineer, coming from other cities, to produce Covid- negative report not
older than 72 Hrs failing which the entry to the campus will be denied.

It=E2=80=99s the most critical time for all of us and hence, together we ca=
n save
the community from this pandemic.

Looking forward to your full cooperation. Thanking you in anticipation.
Team CRT

subject: Notice Regarding Make-Up Application
body:
*BIRLA INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY AND SCIENCE, PILANI*

*AUGS/AGSR DIVISION*



*                                       Notice Regarding Make-Up
Application*


The Make-up application process for the Mid-Semester/ Comprehensive
Examinations has been *made online in *AUGSD-AGSRD website (
https://academic.bits-pilani.ac.in/). Following are the important points in
this regard:

1.    All students must write the Mid-Semester/ Comprehensive examinations.

2.    Students must note that the Make-up will be given only in genuine
cases after thorough examination of the application.

3.    In case of extreme emergency, where make-up is sought, a student can
submit an online application using the AUGSD-AGSRD website (
https://academic.bits-pilani.ac.in/) *prior or within 3 days of exam*.

4.    Note that applications submitted in the hard copy/ via email will
*NOT* be entertained.

5.    Once a student will submit a make-up application, the
Instructor-in-charge (IC) will receive an auto-generated email for further
necessary action(s) on it.

6.    The IC can ask the student to update the make-up application/
schedule personal interaction with the student before taking final
decision/ approve or reject the make-up application by mentioning specific
remarks through his/her AUGSD-AGSRD website portal. In each case, an
auto-generated email will be sent to the student.

7.    As per the Institute Academic Regulation, the decision of the IC in
all matters of make-up shall be final.

8.    In case, the IC rejects the make-up application, as per the Institute
Academic Regulation, a student will be reported NC (Not cleared) for that
particular course.

 *Associate Deans*

*ADDITION / SUBSTITUTION*

=C3=98 The online process for addition/ substitution for *First Degree and
Higher Degree students* is scheduled during *January 27, 2021 (starting
from 10AM) to January 30, 2021 (up to 11:59PM). *

=C3=98 The list of seats available for addition/ substitution in various
Elective courses is *available in AUGS-AGSR Division website (*
https://academic.bits-pilani.ac.in/). You can apply for other course(s)
also which are not mentioned in the list, however, registration will only
be allowed in case of availability of seats vacating due to substituting
out by other students in that course(s).

*Procedure for Addition/Substitution of course*

Addition/Substitution requests will be accepted through *AUGS-AGSR Division
website.*

=C2=B7        The criteria for the addition/ substitution of course(s) will=
 be
as follows:

o   As per the semester wise pattern for First Degree students of various
disciplines, requests for the Humanities elective courses will be processed
in the order starting from second year to final year based on the priority
number (*reverse order*) of a student.

o   Requests for the discipline and open elective courses (other than
Humanities) will be processed in the order starting from final year to
second year based on the priority number (*reverse order*) of a student.
For a particular course, first preference will be given to the student of
same discipline followed by minor student (if any) and then others.

o   Students should ensure that the requested course for addition/
substitution fits in their existing Time Table without any clash. Addition/
substitution request will automatically stand cancel if it creates clash in
Time Table.

=C2=B7        *Compulsory (Core) courses are not allowed for substitution. =
*

=C2=B7        It is individual student=E2=80=99s responsibility, to ensure =
the
eligibility for the course as well as graduation requirements (in terms of
number of units and number of courses).
